LanguageData.GR_WeirdMilk.label: weird milk
LanguageData.GR_WeirdMilk.description: This strange milk has a sour, chemical taste.
LanguageData.GR_MuffalopeMilk.label: muffalope milk
LanguageData.GR_MuffalopeMilk.description: This yellow, thick milk is definitely not edible. It is highly unstable, so it might be used as an improvised explosive if you have the proper knowledge.
LanguageData.GR_MechaMilk.label: mechanoid milk
LanguageData.GR_MechaMilk.description: This metallic, quicksilver-like substance is not edible. It can be processed in a refinery to obtain neutroamine, chemfuel and a bit of silver.
LanguageData.GR_BearffaloMilk.label: bearfallo milk
LanguageData.GR_BearffaloMilk.description: Milk from a bearffalo. Quite high in fat content, and very nutritive.
LanguageData.GR_ThrumffaloMilk.label: thrumffalo milk
LanguageData.GR_ThrumffaloMilk.description: Milk from a thrumffalo. Very nutritive. Also with a sky-high cholesterol content, but in the Rim nobody judges you.
LanguageData.GR_MuffalochickenMilk.label: muffalochicken milk
LanguageData.GR_MuffalochickenMilk.description: This lumpy milk seems to have concentrated protein chunks, tasting like chicken nuggets. Disgusting, but colonists seem to like it.
LanguageData.GR_ChickenffaloMilk.label: chickenffalo milk
LanguageData.GR_ChickenffaloMilk.description: Milk from a chickenffalo. Looks like watered down milk. Probably not much better than water.
LanguageData.GR_MuffalobearMilk.label: muffalobear milk
LanguageData.GR_MuffalobearMilk.description: A delicious milk with roasted overtones. Very pleasurable to eat, but not very nutritious.
LanguageData.GR_WolffaloMilk.label: wolffalo milk
LanguageData.GR_WolffaloMilk.description: This milk seems to be filled with strands of grey wool. Disgusting, and quite hard to drink...
LanguageData.GR_RatMilk.label: ratfallo milk
LanguageData.GR_RatMilk.description: This milk has a rich, thick quality to it. It's origins, however, might be a bit dubious... Unless you trust mafia guys called Tony.
LanguageData.GR_Owlbearfeathers.label: owlbear feathers
LanguageData.GR_Owlbearfeathers.description: Bearchicken feathers can be gathered and processed into a fine powder, which produces a mild euphoric sensation when burned and inhaled.
LanguageData.GR_BearwolfFangs.label: bearwolf fangs
LanguageData.GR_BearwolfFangs.description: The sharpened teeth of a bearwolf. These teeth are essentially useless, but some primitive tribes in the Rimworlds tend to use animal teeth as currency, since they are durable. Someone might pay for these.
LanguageData.GR_RabbitcatFangs.label: rabbitcat fangs
LanguageData.GR_RabbitcatFangs.description: The sharpened teeth of a rabbitcat. These teeth are essentially useless, but some primitive tribes in the Rimworlds tend to use animal teeth as currency, since they are durable. Someone might pay for these.
LanguageData.GR_WolfchickenFeathers.label: wolfchicken feathers
LanguageData.GR_WolfchickenFeathers.description: Wolfchicken feathers are colourful and pretty. Quite useless, but someone might pay for them as a decorative object.
LanguageData.GR_WolfbearPaws.label: wolfbear paws
LanguageData.GR_WolfbearPaws.description: The huge, severed paws of a wolfbear. Such trophies are usually considered by primitive peoples to be a token of good luck. Someone might pay for these.
LanguageData.GR_VerySmallTeeth.label: very small teeth
LanguageData.GR_VerySmallTeeth.description: These minuscule teeth are very durable. Some tribes in the Rimworlds tend to use animal teeth as currency, so they might be slightly valuable.
LanguageData.GR_AlphaBoarTusks.label: paragon boar tusks
LanguageData.GR_AlphaBoarTusks.description: These boar tusks are hard and could probably be carved into a sculpture by someone artistically inclined in a stonecutter's table.
LanguageData.GR_SquirralopeHorn.label: squirralope horn
LanguageData.GR_SquirralopeHorn.description: This horn could probably be used as an improvised melee weapon. It could probably be sold for a tiny profit too.
LanguageData.GR_SquirralopeHorn.tools.0.label: point
LanguageData.GR_SquirralopeHorn.tools.1.label: base
LanguageData.GR_HugeRhinoHorn.label: huge rhino horn
LanguageData.GR_HugeRhinoHorn.description: This immense rhino horn has no intrinsic value or usefulness, but it is often used in non-effectual alternative medicine treatments. Oh well, this is the Rim, it's better than selling slaves (or not, those who could judge didn't survive winter).
LanguageData.GR_SpidersnakeSkin.label: spidersnake shed skin
LanguageData.GR_SpidersnakeSkin.description: This shed skin can be ground and processed at a drug lab to extract minute amounts of neutroamine.
LanguageData.GR_HugeBearPelt.label: huge bear pelt
LanguageData.GR_HugeBearPelt.description: This enormous bear pelt is probably valuable as a trade good. Or it can also be repurposed as a huge rug.
LanguageData.GR_HugeBearCatPelt.label: bearcat pelt
LanguageData.GR_HugeBearCatPelt.description: This enormous bear pelt is probably valuable as a trade good. Or it can also be repurposed as a huge rug.
LanguageData.GR_WolfPelt.label: wolf pelt
LanguageData.GR_WolfPelt.description: This wolf pelt can be used as a trade good. It can also be crafted into a decorative wolf rug.
LanguageData.GR_MuffaloPelt.label: muffalo pelt
LanguageData.GR_MuffaloPelt.description: Cool! You can now make your own Game of Thrones / Rimworld cosplay! Or it can also be repurposed as a comfy rug.
LanguageData.GR_EmuFatOintment.label: emu fat ointment
LanguageData.GR_EmuFatOintment.description: This clump of emu fat can be used as a medicinal ointment.
LanguageData.GR_ChocolateEgg.label: chocolate egg
LanguageData.GR_ChocolateEgg.description: An egg made of good quality chocolate. Delicious!
LanguageData.GR_BaconStrips.label: bacon jerky
LanguageData.GR_BaconStrips.description: Preserved, salted strips of dried bacon. Can be stored for months without refrigeration.
LanguageData.GR_JamonSerrano.label: jamon serrano
LanguageData.GR_JamonSerrano.description: This dry-cured ham is considered a delicacy. It is generally served in thin slices, occasionally diced. It can be stored for a long time without refrigeration.
LanguageData.GR_TortoiseShell.label: hardened tortoise shell
LanguageData.GR_TortoiseShell.description: A very rare, hard material produced from the shells of slaughtered giant tortoises. Not practical for mass use, unless you can get a TON of tortoises.
LanguageData.GR_Castoreum.label: beaverwolf castoreum
LanguageData.GR_Castoreum.description: Castoreum is a yellowish exudate from the castor sacs of beavers. It is historically used as a food additive and natural flavour, often as a substitute vanilla flavour.
LanguageData.GR_BearffaloWool.label: bearffalo wool
LanguageData.GR_BearffaloWool.description: Coarse, strong wool. Bearffalo wool provides heat protection, and decent defense.
LanguageData.GR_HairballWool.label: hairball wool
LanguageData.GR_HairballWool.description: This is a strange wool, very light, and covered with what seems to be a lattice of coarse hairs. It provides excellent heat insulation due to its thermostatic properties.
LanguageData.GR_BoomffaloWool.label: boomffalo wool
LanguageData.GR_BoomffaloWool.description: Brittle, strange smelling wool. Not the best wool to craft apparel with, though it's better than nothing. Provides nice heat insulation.
LanguageData.GR_MuffalopeWool.label: muffalope wool
LanguageData.GR_MuffalopeWool.description: This wool seems to be constantly dripping unstable chemical compounds. Not the best wool to craft apparel with, though it's better than nothing. Provides nice heat insulation.
LanguageData.GR_ChickenffaloWool.label: chickenffalo wool
LanguageData.GR_ChickenffaloWool.description: The strands of this pure white wool are incredibly small and complex. Gives good defense against sharp attacks for a wool.
LanguageData.GR_MuffalochickenWool.label: muffalochicken wool
LanguageData.GR_MuffalochickenWool.description: This seems to be an amalgamation of feathers and wool, perfectly interweaved. Gives nice defense against blunt attacks, as well as insulation.
LanguageData.GR_MuffalowolfWool.label: muffalowolf wool
LanguageData.GR_MuffalowolfWool.description: This dark grey wool is stylish and very warm.
LanguageData.GR_WolffaloWool.label: wolffalo wool
LanguageData.GR_WolffaloWool.description: This dark grey wool is stylish and very warm.
LanguageData.GR_ChickenspiderSilk.label: chickenspider silk
LanguageData.GR_ChickenspiderSilk.description: Fabric spun from fibers extracted from chickenspiders. Resists blunt and sharp damage easily, but provides almost no protection against extreme heat.
LanguageData.GR_SpidersnakeSilk.label: spidersnake silk
LanguageData.GR_SpidersnakeSilk.description: Fabric spun from fibers extracted from spidersnakes. A balanced fabric to make apparel from.
LanguageData.GR_MuffalopedeChitin.label: muffalopede wool
LanguageData.GR_MuffalopedeChitin.description: Insectoid chitin can be used as a material to craft apparel. It provides excellent protection against blunt attacks.
LanguageData.GR_WolfsnakeSkin.label: wolfsnake skin
LanguageData.GR_WolfsnakeSkin.description: Shed skin from a wolfsnake. Light, strong, and insulates well.
LanguageData.GR_ThrumbearWool.label: thrumbear wool
LanguageData.GR_ThrumbearWool.description: Thrumbear wool is thick and warm. Probably the best wool in the animal kingdom.
LanguageData.GR_ThrumffaloWool.label: thrumffalo wool
LanguageData.GR_ThrumffaloWool.description: Thrumffalo wool is the best protection against extreme climates there is.
LanguageData.GR_MechaWool.label: mechanoid wool
LanguageData.GR_MechaWool.description: This wool seems to be strengthened by plasteel micro-fibers, and covered with advanced circuitry.
LanguageData.GR_BearGenetic.label: bear genetic material
LanguageData.GR_BearGenetic.description: A vial of genetic material extracted from a bear's corpse.
LanguageData.GR_ChickenGenetic.label: chicken genetic material
LanguageData.GR_ChickenGenetic.description: A vial of genetic material extracted from a chicken's corpse.
LanguageData.GR_BoomalopeGenetic.label: boomalope genetic material
LanguageData.GR_BoomalopeGenetic.description: A vial of genetic material extracted from a boomalope's corpse.
LanguageData.GR_MuffaloGenetic.label: muffalo genetic material
LanguageData.GR_MuffaloGenetic.description: A vial of genetic material extracted from a muffalo's corpse.
LanguageData.GR_WolfGenetic.label: wolf genetic material
LanguageData.GR_WolfGenetic.description: A vial of genetic material extracted from a wolf's corpse.
LanguageData.GR_RodentGenetic.label: rodent/leporid genetic material
LanguageData.GR_RodentGenetic.description: A vial of genetic material extracted from a rodent or leporid corpse.
LanguageData.GR_FelineGenetic.label: feline genetic material
LanguageData.GR_FelineGenetic.description: A vial of genetic material extracted from a feline corpse.
LanguageData.GR_InsectoidGenetic.label: insectoid genetic material
LanguageData.GR_InsectoidGenetic.description: A vial of genetic material extracted from an insectoid's corpse.
LanguageData.GR_ReptilianGenetic.label: reptilian genetic material
LanguageData.GR_ReptilianGenetic.description: A vial of genetic material extracted from a reptilian corpse.
LanguageData.GR_HumanoidGenetic.label: humanoid genetic material
LanguageData.GR_HumanoidGenetic.description: A vial of genetic material extracted from a humanoid corpse.
LanguageData.GR_ThrumboGenetic.label: thrumbo genetic material
LanguageData.GR_ThrumboGenetic.description: A vial of genetic material extracted from a thrumbo's corpse.
LanguageData.GR_MechanoidGenetic.label: mechanoid active components
LanguageData.GR_MechanoidGenetic.description: A vial of active mechanites from a mechanoid's corpse.
LanguageData.GR_NonSpecializedGenetic.label: non-specialized genetic material
LanguageData.GR_NonSpecializedGenetic.description: This vial of genetic material contains non-specialized cells that can't be used to create animal hybrids. They can probably be used in a gene recombinator to turn them into more useful genetic materials, though.
LanguageData.GR_BearSerum.label: bear paragon serum
LanguageData.GR_BearSerum.description: A vial of paragon genes extracted from a bear's corpse.
LanguageData.GR_BoarSerum.label: boar paragon serum
LanguageData.GR_BoarSerum.description: A vial of paragon genes extracted from a wild boar's corpse.
LanguageData.GR_BoomalopeSerum.label: boomalope paragon serum
LanguageData.GR_BoomalopeSerum.description: A vial of paragon genes extracted from a wild boomalope's corpse.
LanguageData.GR_ChickenSerum.label: chicken paragon serum
LanguageData.GR_ChickenSerum.description: A vial of paragon genes extracted from a chicken's corpse.
LanguageData.GR_EmuSerum.label: emu paragon serum
LanguageData.GR_EmuSerum.description: A vial of paragon genes extracted from an emu's corpse.
LanguageData.GR_MuffaloSerum.label: muffalo paragon serum
LanguageData.GR_MuffaloSerum.description: A vial of paragon genes extracted from a muffalo's corpse.
LanguageData.GR_OstrichSerum.label: ostrich paragon serum
LanguageData.GR_OstrichSerum.description: A vial of paragon genes extracted from an ostrich's corpse.
LanguageData.GR_RhinoSerum.label: rhino paragon serum
LanguageData.GR_RhinoSerum.description: A vial of paragon genes extracted from a rhino's corpse.
LanguageData.GR_WolfSerum.label: wolf paragon serum
LanguageData.GR_WolfSerum.description: A vial of paragon genes extracted from a wolf's corpse.
LanguageData.GR_HareSerum.label: hare paragon serum
LanguageData.GR_HareSerum.description: A vial of paragon genes extracted from a hare's corpse.
LanguageData.GR_IguanaSerum.label: iguana paragon serum
LanguageData.GR_IguanaSerum.description: A vial of paragon genes extracted from an iguana's corpse.
LanguageData.GR_PigSerum.label: pig paragon serum
LanguageData.GR_PigSerum.description: A vial of paragon genes extracted from a pig's corpse.
LanguageData.GR_RatSerum.label: rat paragon serum
LanguageData.GR_RatSerum.description: A vial of paragon genes extracted from a rat's corpse.
LanguageData.GR_TortoiseSerum.label: tortoise paragon serum
LanguageData.GR_TortoiseSerum.description: A vial of paragon genes extracted from a tortoise's corpse.
LanguageData.GR_OrganicPulp.label: organic pulp
LanguageData.GR_OrganicPulp.description: This organic pulp can be used as an organic growth compound to accelerate some of the genetic processes. Needed to upgrade the Gene Pod and to build many of Genetic Rim's buildings.
LanguageData.GR_ImplantSteelWireMesh.label: hybrid implant steel wire mesh (tier 1)
LanguageData.GR_ImplantSteelWireMesh.description: This steel wire mesh acts as a sterile scaffold for tissue growth. It is used as the base for basic vat grown hybrid implants. More advanced implants require a plasteel based wire mesh.
LanguageData.GR_ImplantPlasteelWireMesh.label: hybrid implant plasteel wire mesh (tier 2)
LanguageData.GR_ImplantPlasteelWireMesh.description: This plasteel wire mesh acts as a sterile scaffold for tissue growth. It is used as the base for advanced vat grown hybrid implants. Elite implants require an uranium based wire mesh.
LanguageData.GR_ImplantUraniumWireMesh.label: hybrid implant uranium wire mesh (tier 3)
LanguageData.GR_ImplantUraniumWireMesh.description: This uranium wire mesh acts as a sterile scaffold for tissue growth. It is used as the base for the most elite vat grown hybrid implants.
LanguageData.GR_Cryofuel.label: cryofuel
LanguageData.GR_Cryofuel.description: Volatile liquid chemical compound stored in cryogenic containers. Can be used to power a cryo-stabilized generator. It can also be converted to regular Chemfuel in a refinery.
LanguageData.GR_StabilizingGenes.label: stabilizing genes
LanguageData.GR_StabilizingGenes.description: This genetic cocktail hasn't differentiated yet.
LanguageData.GR_StabilizingSerum.label: stabilizing serum
LanguageData.GR_StabilizingSerum.description: This genetic cocktail hasn't differentiated yet.
LanguageData.GR_RuinedGenetic.label: ruined genetic material
LanguageData.GR_RuinedGenetic.description: This genetic material is ruined. Useless, though some merchant may pay a pittance for the glass shards.
LanguageData.GR_Proj_ThrownSac.label: thrown sac
LanguageData.GR_PlasmaBurst.label: plasma burst
LanguageData.GR_SmokeBomb.label: smokepop shell
LanguageData.GR_IncendiaryMote.label: incendiary bolt
LanguageData.GR_SniperFlechette.label: sniper flechette
LanguageData.GR_RazorProjectile.label: razor scythe
LanguageData.GR_Laser.label: laser beam
LanguageData.GR_Disintegrator.label: disintegrator beam
LanguageData.GR_StunBolt.label: stun bolt
LanguageData.GR_PoisonBlast.label: poison blast
LanguageData.GR_HairballProjectile.label: hairball
LanguageData.GR_GreatHairballProjectile.label: greater hairball
LanguageData.GR_CryoBlast.label: cryo blast
LanguageData.GR_Warhead.label: antigrain warhead
LanguageData.GR_FilthMucus.label: mucus
LanguageData.GR_Gas_Ice.label: ice crystals
LanguageData.GR_Poison_Gas.label: poison gas
LanguageData.GR_Hairballs.label: hairballs
LanguageData.GR_Poison_Cloud.label: poison cloud
LanguageData.GR_InsectCloudMotes.label: insect clouds
LanguageData.GR_Gas_Dust.label: dust
LanguageData.GR_Weapon_ThrownSac.label: explosive sac
LanguageData.GR_Weapon_ThrownSac.description: This organic sac is filled with an unstable chemical that will explode on contact.
LanguageData.GR_Weapon_ThrownSac.verbs.0.label: throw explosive sac
LanguageData.GR_AberrantFleshbeast.label: aberrant fleshbeast
LanguageData.GR_AberrantFleshbeast.description: Something went terribly wrong. This wretched creature is struggling to keep breathing.
LanguageData.GR_AberrantFleshbeast.tools.0.label: bite
LanguageData.GR_AlphaBear.label: paragon bear
LanguageData.GR_AlphaBear.description: This massive bear can grow to sizes dwarfing regular grizzly bears, reaching up to a metrical ton in weight. Their thick pelt is an almost perfect adaptation to cold climates, allowing them to survive for months in hibernation if necessary. While still omnivorous, their teeth are better suited to a higher degree of herbivory than grizzly bears.\n\nUseful abilities: Paragon bear pelts can be sold for profit, or converted into decorational rugs.
LanguageData.GR_AlphaBear.tools.0.label: left claw
LanguageData.GR_AlphaBear.tools.1.label: right claw
LanguageData.GR_AlphaBear.tools.3.label: head
LanguageData.GR_AlphaWildBoar.label: paragon wild boar
LanguageData.GR_AlphaWildBoar.description: This strong, muscular creature is fiercely territorial, and its powerful curved tusks can be extremely dangerous for the unwary hunter.\n\nUseful abilities: Paragon wild boar tusks are prized for their ivory, and can be carved into statuettes.
LanguageData.GR_AlphaWildBoar.tools.0.label: tusk
LanguageData.GR_AlphaWildBoar.tools.2.label: head
LanguageData.GR_AlphaBoomalope.label: paragon boomalope
LanguageData.GR_AlphaBoomalope.description: This tall, lean ungulate usually acts as the dominant individual on a herd of boomalopes. More resistant and stronger than regular boomalopes, the paragon boomalopes also carry greater quantities of unstable chemical filled sacs, so no predator wants to even get close to them.\n\nUseful abilities: Paragon boomalopes explode when killed, with greater force than regular boomalopes. They also produce large amounts of chemfuel.
LanguageData.GR_AlphaBoomalope.tools.0.label: head
LanguageData.GR_AlphaChicken.label: paragon chicken
LanguageData.GR_AlphaChicken.description: This huge chicken towers above its regular brethren. Eggs laid by this species are the stuff of legends.\n\nUseful abilities: Fast breeding, more meat than regular chickens, and delicious eggs. A nice farm animal!
LanguageData.GR_AlphaChicken.tools.0.label: claws
LanguageData.GR_AlphaChicken.tools.2.label: head
LanguageData.GR_AlphaEmu.label: paragon emu
LanguageData.GR_AlphaEmu.description: This huge flightless bird is incredibly bad tempered and ugly as sin. However, it produces some enormous eggs, and its fat can be rubbed on skin and used as a primitive bush medicine.\n\nUseful abilities: Very nutritive eggs. Once slaughtered, its fat can be used as a basic medicine.
LanguageData.GR_AlphaEmu.tools.0.label: claws
LanguageData.GR_AlphaEmu.tools.2.label: head
LanguageData.GR_AlphaMuffalo.label: paragon muffalo
LanguageData.GR_AlphaMuffalo.description: A huge, hairy quadruped perfectly adapted to extreme cold climates. Peaceful unless disturbed.\n\nUseful abilities: Pack animal. Produces milk and wool in slightly greater quantities than a regular muffalo. It's pelt is valuable, and can be used as a decorative rug.
LanguageData.GR_AlphaMuffalo.tools.0.label: head
LanguageData.GR_AlphaOstrich.label: paragon ostrich
LanguageData.GR_AlphaOstrich.description: A truly enormous ostrich. This flightless bird lays huge eggs, very nutritive.\n\nUseful abilities: Lays the biggest eggs of any non-hybrid creature.
LanguageData.GR_AlphaOstrich.tools.0.label: claws
LanguageData.GR_AlphaOstrich.tools.2.label: head
LanguageData.GR_AlphaRhinoceros.label: paragon rhinoceros
LanguageData.GR_AlphaRhinoceros.description: The very ground trembles when this massive herbivore moves. Although usually quite peaceful, it can be very aggressive when provoked. Its horn is considered to be very valuable, despite lack of scientific evidence of it being useful at all in fields like medicine.\n\nUseful abilities: It's horn is valuable, and... you don't want to be in the path of a charging paragon rhinoceros.
LanguageData.GR_AlphaRhinoceros.tools.0.label: horn
LanguageData.GR_AlphaRhinoceros.tools.1.label: horn
LanguageData.GR_AlphaRhinoceros.tools.3.label: head
LanguageData.GR_AlphaWolfTimber.label: paragon timber wolf
LanguageData.GR_AlphaWolfTimber.description: This huge wolf can be turned into a fierce, loyal companion if properly trained. Wolf pelts have long been used as trade goods.\n\nUseful abilities: The paragon wolf's pelt can be traded for a profit, or used to craft a wolf pelt rug, which isn't tacky at all. Nope.
LanguageData.GR_AlphaWolfTimber.tools.0.label: left claw
LanguageData.GR_AlphaWolfTimber.tools.1.label: right claw
LanguageData.GR_AlphaWolfTimber.tools.3.label: head
LanguageData.GR_AlphaHare.label: paragon hare
LanguageData.GR_AlphaHare.description: This small creature has a fierce gaze and quite a poor disposition. Be careful with these critters, since they breed like... well... rabbits.\n\nUseful abilities: Due to a terrible sense of humour in your scientists, this creatures lays edible chocolate eggs...
LanguageData.GR_AlphaHare.tools.1.label: head
LanguageData.GR_AlphaIguana.label: paragon iguana
LanguageData.GR_AlphaIguana.description: This large lizard has a beautiful iridiscent sheen on its scales. Contrary to the regular iguanas, this paragon specimen has a nasty venomous bite.\n\nUseful abilities: Lays eggs and has a venomous bite.
LanguageData.GR_AlphaIguana.tools.0.label: left claw
LanguageData.GR_AlphaIguana.tools.1.label: right claw
LanguageData.GR_AlphaIguana.tools.3.label: head
LanguageData.GR_AlphaPig.label: paragon pig
LanguageData.GR_AlphaPig.description: This huge pig has a voracious appetite, but the quality of its meat is legendary.\n\nUseful abilities: The butchering process will produce bacon jerky and jamn serrano, two delicacies that can be stored for months without refrigeration.
LanguageData.GR_AlphaPig.tools.1.label: head
LanguageData.GR_AlphaRat.label: paragon rat
LanguageData.GR_AlphaRat.description: This rat is obviously disease ridden.\n\nUseful abilities: Paragon rats spread the bubonic plague when they bite. Careful!
LanguageData.GR_AlphaRat.tools.0.label: left claw
LanguageData.GR_AlphaRat.tools.1.label: right claw
LanguageData.GR_AlphaRat.tools.3.label: head
LanguageData.GR_AlphaTortoise.label: paragon tortoise
LanguageData.GR_AlphaTortoise.description: This heavily armored land-dwelling reptile is known for its slow moving speed and surprisingly vicious bite.\n\nUseful abilities: Paragon tortoises can be butchered to obtain their shells, and with a big enough tortoise farm it could probably be used as a building material.
LanguageData.GR_AlphaTortoise.tools.1.label: head
LanguageData.GR_ArchotechCentipede.label: archotech centipede
LanguageData.GR_ArchotechCentipede.description: The Archotech Centipede is the end result of the Archotech Project, aiming to provide a "friendly" machine superintelligence with a capable body. Even though this centipede is forcefully loyal to the colonists, and can be somewhat controlled by them, most other inhabitants of the planet will consider its existance to be an abomination, since dabbling in archotech usually signals the end of comprehensible human life.\n\nUseful abilities: What do you mean useful? You have WON the game. The Archotech Centipede is basically unkillable by normal means, just use it to lay waste to everything in the planet. You don't have enemies now, you have pets. Ooooor... the archotech may kill all your colonists. One of the two.
LanguageData.GR_ArchotechCentipede.tools.0.label: head
LanguageData.GR_Bearalope.label: bearalope
LanguageData.GR_Bearalope.description: A bear / boomalope hybrid. Not as strong in melee as a pure bear, but its unstable chemical reservoirs explode with great force when it dies. Unfortunately, the extreme virulence of these chemicals is harmful to the creature, and they have very short, miserable lifespans.\n\nUseful abilities: Big explosion produced on hybrid's death. Decent chemfuel production.
LanguageData.GR_Bearalope.tools.0.label: left claw
LanguageData.GR_Bearalope.tools.1.label: right claw
LanguageData.GR_Bearalope.tools.3.label: head
LanguageData.GR_Bearchicken.label: bearchicken
LanguageData.GR_Bearchicken.description: A bear / chicken hybrid. Nicknamed "owlbear" by the colonists. Much weaker in melee than a bear, but it lays eggs, and can obviously defend itself in combat much better than a chicken.\n\nUseful abilities: Lays eggs and regularly produces feathers, which can be converted into Featherdust joints.
LanguageData.GR_Bearchicken.tools.0.label: left claw
LanguageData.GR_Bearchicken.tools.1.label: right claw
LanguageData.GR_Bearchicken.tools.3.label: head
LanguageData.GR_Bearffalo.label: bearffalo
LanguageData.GR_Bearffalo.description: A bear / muffalo hybrid. This hulking, wooly bear is a very temperamental pack animal, valued for its hardiness.\n\nUseful abilities: Produces specific high-quality milk and wool. Acts as a pack beast.
LanguageData.GR_Bearffalo.tools.0.label: left claw
LanguageData.GR_Bearffalo.tools.1.label: right claw
LanguageData.GR_Bearffalo.tools.3.label: head
LanguageData.GR_Bearwolf.label: bearwolf
LanguageData.GR_Bearwolf.description: A bear / wolf hybrid. Strong like a bear, and fast like a wolf. Excellent as a rapid strike force, but their fast metabolism means they need a lot of food.\n\nUseful abilities: Good guard animal. Butchering gives Bearwolf Fangs, which can be sold.
LanguageData.GR_Bearwolf.tools.0.label: left claw
LanguageData.GR_Bearwolf.tools.1.label: right claw
LanguageData.GR_Bearwolf.tools.3.label: head
LanguageData.GR_Bearmole.label: bearmole
LanguageData.GR_Bearmole.description: A Bear / Mole hybrid. This blind animal has a very acute sense of vibrations, alllowing it to detect its prey even better than a sighted animal.\n\nUseful abilities: Good guard animal. Very fast breeding.
LanguageData.GR_Bearmole.tools.0.label: left claw
LanguageData.GR_Bearmole.tools.1.label: right claw
LanguageData.GR_Bearmole.tools.3.label: head
LanguageData.GR_Bearcat.label: bearcat
LanguageData.GR_Bearcat.description: A Bear / Cat hybrid. This hybrid is like a beefed up cougar. A solitary hunter that stalks its prey and attacks it with blinding speed.\n\nUseful abilities: Like all cat hybrids, they have an improved melee dodge ability, making them perfect for the front lines, and a short nuzzle period. The Bearcat can also be slaughtered for its valuable pelt.
LanguageData.GR_Bearcat.tools.0.label: left claw
LanguageData.GR_Bearcat.tools.1.label: right claw
LanguageData.GR_Bearcat.tools.3.label: head
LanguageData.GR_Boomabear.label: boomabear
LanguageData.GR_Boomabear.description: A boomalope / bear hybrid. Stronger than a standard Boomalope, and explodes with a small, concentrated burst when downed. Very dangerous in tight, confined spaces.\n\nUseful abilities: The only boomalope hybrid exploding with Bomb damage instead of Flame. Dangerous!. Decent chemfuel production.
LanguageData.GR_Boomabear.tools.1.label: head
LanguageData.GR_Boomachicken.label: boomachicken
LanguageData.GR_Boomachicken.description: A Boomalope / chicken hybrid. These creatures produce two types of eggs: the regular kind, and a special type of egg filled to the brim with dangerous chemicals. These aberrant eggs aren't normally laid, and they are liberated when the creature dies. In contact with the atmosphere, they explode violently in a few seconds.\n\nUseful abilities: Eggxplosion!! Weak chemfuel production.
LanguageData.GR_Boomachicken.tools.0.label: head
LanguageData.GR_Boomachicken.tools.1.label: bite
LanguageData.GR_Boomffalo.label: boomffalo
LanguageData.GR_Boomffalo.description: A Boomalope / Muffalo hybrid. A bit unstable to transport goods, so it isn't ever used as a pack animal, but it produces milk and wool. From a genetic engineering standpoint, these creatures are hard to stabilize, since the muffalo's biology is incompatible with the boomalope's chemical sacs. A cocktail of chemical refrigerants is used to maintain a delicate balance.\n\nUseful abilities: Produces low quality milk and average wool. Explodes with Frostbite damage on death. Produces a specialized cryofuel which can be used to power a cryofuel engine.
LanguageData.GR_Boomffalo.tools.0.label: head
LanguageData.GR_Boomwolf.label: boomwolf
LanguageData.GR_Boomwolf.description: A Boomalope / Wolf hybrid. Faster than a standard boomalope, and capable of delivering a powerful bite. \n\nUseful abilities: Explodes on death with great concussive force, stunning any creature caught in its blast radius. Produces low amounts of chemfuel every day.
LanguageData.GR_Boomwolf.tools.1.label: head
LanguageData.GR_Squirralope.label: squirralope
LanguageData.GR_Squirralope.description: A Boomalope / Squirrel hybrid. Slightly smaller than other boomalope hybrids. While lacking in size, it is faster moving, faster breeding and faster producing chemfuel than base boomalopes.\n\nUseful abilities: Explodes on death. Produces more chemfuel than regular boomalopes. Very fast breeding. Can be slaughtered for their horns.
LanguageData.GR_Squirralope.tools.0.label: left claw
LanguageData.GR_Squirralope.tools.1.label: right claw
LanguageData.GR_Squirralope.tools.3.label: head
LanguageData.GR_Boomacat.label: boomacat
LanguageData.GR_Boomacat.description: A Boomalope / Cat hybrid. This is a peaceful, solitary creature that expends its time licking its fur and preferring to be left alone.\n\nUseful abilities: Like all cat hybrids, they have an improved melee dodge ability, making them perfect for the front lines, and a short nuzzle period. Explodes on death creating a fine mist of hairballs that can suffocate anyone unlucky enough to be caught in them. Produces low amounts of chemfuel every day.
LanguageData.GR_Boomacat.tools.1.label: head
LanguageData.GR_Catbear.label: catbear
LanguageData.GR_Catbear.description: A cat / bear hybrid. Catbears are intelligent and affectionate, a perfect companion. They are also quite more resilient than your average cat.\n\nUseful abilities: Like all cat hybrids, they have an improved melee dodge ability, which in the case of these small animals is ideal to get out of a fight, and a short nuzzle period.
LanguageData.GR_Catbear.tools.0.label: left claw
LanguageData.GR_Catbear.tools.1.label: right claw
LanguageData.GR_Catbear.tools.3.label: head
LanguageData.GR_Catalope.label: catalope
LanguageData.GR_Catalope.description: A cat / boomalope hybrid. It's like a miniature boomalope! Or a exploding kitten! Terrifying either way.\n\nUseful abilities: Like all cat hybrids, they have an improved melee dodge ability, which in the case of these small animals is ideal to get out of a fight, and a short nuzzle period. The catalope produces small quantities of chemfuel, and explodes with a tiny hairball cloud.
LanguageData.GR_Catalope.tools.1.label: head
LanguageData.GR_Catchicken.label: catchicken
LanguageData.GR_Catchicken.description: A cat / chicken hybrid. Catchicken might not be as intelligent as other cat hybrids, but they make up for it with their ability to lay eggs quickly.\n\nUseful abilities: Like all cat hybrids, they have an improved melee dodge ability, which in the case of these small animals is ideal to get out of a fight, and a short nuzzle period. Quite fast egg laying.
LanguageData.GR_Catchicken.tools.1.label: head
LanguageData.GR_Catfallo.label: catfallo
LanguageData.GR_Catfallo.description: A cat / muffalo hybrid. The catfallo is slightly larger than other cat hybrids, and can be used as a miniature pack beast.\n\nUseful abilities: Like all cat hybrids, they have an improved melee dodge ability, which in the case of these small animals is ideal to get out of a fight, and a short nuzzle period. It produces milk and wool in small amounts.
LanguageData.GR_Catfallo.tools.0.label: head
LanguageData.GR_Catfallo.tools.1.label: left hoof
LanguageData.GR_Catfallo.tools.2.label: right hoof
LanguageData.GR_Catrabbit.label: catrabbit
LanguageData.GR_Catrabbit.description: A cat / rabbit hybrid. This long-eared cat breeds extremely fast, and is intelligent enough to be trained in the most basic sense.\n\nUseful abilities: Like all cat hybrids, they have an improved melee dodge ability, which in the case of these small animals is ideal to get out of a fight, and a short nuzzle period. Very fast breeding.
LanguageData.GR_Catrabbit.tools.0.label: left claw
LanguageData.GR_Catrabbit.tools.1.label: right claw
LanguageData.GR_Catrabbit.tools.3.label: head
LanguageData.GR_Catwolf.label: catwolf
LanguageData.GR_Catwolf.description: A cat / wolf hybrid. Catwolves are extremely intelligent cat hybrids, and they can be trained to haul. Not much, mind you, since they are quite small, but if you have an army of them the net result will be the same. Another positive note is that you will have hauling cats without needing to delve into the depths of weird weeaboo catgirl mods. NO SIR, we have enough weirdness here with the ovipositors and such.\n\nUseful abilities: Like all cat hybrids, they have an improved melee dodge ability, which in the case of these small animals is ideal to get out of a fight, and a short nuzzle period. Fast and intelligent.
LanguageData.GR_Catwolf.tools.0.label: left claw
LanguageData.GR_Catwolf.tools.1.label: right claw
LanguageData.GR_Catwolf.tools.3.label: head
LanguageData.GR_Chickenbear.label: chickenbear
LanguageData.GR_Chickenbear.description: A chicken / bear hybrid. Lays eggs, and can defend itself in combat slightly better than a chicken. \n\nUseful abilities: Their sharp, small teeth can be harvested when butchering them, and they are slightly valuable and lightweight.
LanguageData.GR_Chickenbear.tools.0.label: claws
LanguageData.GR_Chickenbear.tools.2.label: head
LanguageData.GR_Chickenlope.label: chickenlope
LanguageData.GR_Chickenlope.description: A chicken / boomalope hybrid. This sickly looking creature is basically useless. Now, if you gather a lot of them, and kill them in a chain reaction... \n\nUseful abilities: Explodes on death. Produces minute amounts of chemfuel every day.
LanguageData.GR_Chickenlope.tools.0.label: claws
LanguageData.GR_Chickenlope.tools.2.label: head
LanguageData.GR_Chickenffalo.label: chickenffalo
LanguageData.GR_Chickenffalo.description: A chicken / muffalo hybrid. Lays eggs, produces milk, wool and can be used as a pack beast. Of course, it doesn't excel at ANY of those things, but it's the price you pay for convenience. They are so cute, though, wearing their tiny bags...
LanguageData.GR_Chickenffalo.tools.0.label: claws
LanguageData.GR_Chickenffalo.tools.1.label: head
LanguageData.GR_Chickenwolf.label: chickenwolf
LanguageData.GR_Chickenwolf.description: A chicken / wolf hybrid. Fast moving, and with a nasty bite! \n\nUseful abilities: Their sharp, small teeth can be harvested when butchering them, and they are slightly valuable and lightweight.
LanguageData.GR_Chickenwolf.tools.0.label: claws
LanguageData.GR_Chickenwolf.tools.2.label: head
LanguageData.GR_Chickenrabbit.label: chickenrabbit
LanguageData.GR_Chickenrabbit.description: A Chicken / Rabbit hybrid. What happens when you artificially crossbreed two fast breeding creatures? The chickenrabbit is an ecological disaster waiting to happen.\n\nUseful abilities: Egg layer. EXTREMELY fast breeding.
LanguageData.GR_Chickenrabbit.tools.0.label: claws
LanguageData.GR_Chickenrabbit.tools.2.label: head
LanguageData.GR_Chickencat.label: chickencat
LanguageData.GR_Chickencat.description: A chicken / cat hybrid. Fast moving, specially intelligent. It is one of the few chicken hybrids that can be somewhat trained.\n\nUseful abilities: Like all cat hybrids, they have an improved melee dodge ability, making them perfect for the front lines, and a short nuzzle period. The chickencat obviously produces eggs.
LanguageData.GR_Chickencat.tools.0.label: claws
LanguageData.GR_Chickencat.tools.2.label: head
LanguageData.GR_Bearscarab.label: bearscarab
LanguageData.GR_Bearscarab.description: A bear / megascarab hybrid. These huge scarabs are highly intelligent and can be easily trained to behave like guard dogs. Unfortunately, they can't reproduce on their own.\n\nUseful abilities: Produces royal jelly, a mild stimulant that improves colonists' mood.
LanguageData.GR_Bearscarab.tools.1.label: head
LanguageData.GR_Boombeetle.label: boombeetle
LanguageData.GR_Boombeetle.description: A boomalope / megascarab hybrid. These huge insects are often nicknamed "bombardier beetles", due to their ability to throw explosive sacs of unstable chemicals. While this could theoretically be used as a defensive asset for the colony, the beetles are not very intelligent, and tend to either flee at the sign of danger or stand around confused. Unfortunately, they can't reproduce on their own\n\nUseful abilities: ranged attack, and explosive sacs are periodically generated by the boombeetle, working as one-shot grenades that the colonists can use.
LanguageData.GR_Boombeetle.tools.1.label: head
LanguageData.GR_Chickenspider.label: chickenspider
LanguageData.GR_Chickenspider.description: A chicken / megaspider hybrid. These spidery creatures produce a highly valued silk, and can lay eggs and reproduce unlike other eusocial insects.\n\nUseful abilities: silk production.
LanguageData.GR_Chickenspider.tools.1.label: head
LanguageData.GR_Muffalopede.label: muffalopede
LanguageData.GR_Muffalopede.description: A muffalo / spelopede hybrid. This inmense, grub-like creature is one of the few insectoids that produce Insect Jelly. It also sheds chitin every few days, which can be used to craft apparel. Contrary to other eusocial insects, they can reproduce on their own.\n\nUseful abilities: Packs animal. Periodically produces Muffalopede chitin and Insect Jelly.
LanguageData.GR_Muffalopede.tools.1.label: head
LanguageData.GR_Thrumbospider.label: thrumbospider
LanguageData.GR_Thrumbospider.description: A thrumbo / megaspider hybrid. The voracious appetite of the thrumbo, combined with the fast metabolism of the megaspider makes this creature very very difficult to maintain and take care of, but in combat power it is almost unbeatable, albeit slow. Unfortunately, they can't reproduce on their own.\n\nUseful abilities: If properly trained, this creature will utterly destroy your enemies.
LanguageData.GR_Thrumbospider.tools.1.label: head
LanguageData.GR_Wolfscarab.label: wolfscarab
LanguageData.GR_Wolfscarab.description: A wolf / megascarab hybrid. These ferocious creatures are faster than most animals, and really effective in combat. Unfortunately, they can't reproduce on their own.\n\nUseful abilities: Much faster than most other creatures.
LanguageData.GR_Wolfscarab.tools.1.label: head
LanguageData.GR_Spidercat.label: spidercat
LanguageData.GR_Spidercat.description: A megaspider / cat hybrid. Spidercat, spidercat, does whatever a spider cat....... Sorry. This unnerving abomination will certainly keep your colony free from rats.\n\nUseful abilities: Like all cat hybrids, they have an improved melee dodge ability, making them perfect for the front lines, and a short nuzzle period. The spidercat also has the ability to attack from range, throwing disgusting hairball projectiles.
LanguageData.GR_Spidercat.tools.0.label: mandibles
LanguageData.GR_Spidercat.tools.1.label: head
LanguageData.GR_Mechabear.label: mechabear
LanguageData.GR_Mechabear.description: This cybernetic beast has been mutated far beyond its original form. Heavily armoured to withstand heavy fire, and armed with a terrifying plasma cannon. Like all mechanoid hybrids, it doesn't need to eat, it can't reproduce and it doesn't age. It needs to rest a bit to recharge its organic components.\n\nUseful abilities: As long as a tamer is near to direct it, the mechabear is an effective weapons platform, akin to a rocket turret. Like all mechanoid hybrids it produces industrial components every couple days.
LanguageData.GR_Mechabear.tools.0.label: head
LanguageData.GR_Mechalope.label: mechalope
LanguageData.GR_Mechalope.description: This cybernetic boomalope has been outfitted with four mechanized chemfuel reservoirs. The creature can use these reservoirs to produce a jet of burning fuel similar to a flamethrower, not incredibly harmful, but perfect for starting huge fires. Like all mechanoid hybrids, it doesn't need to eat, it can't reproduce and it doesn't age. It needs to rest a bit to recharge its organic components.\n\nUseful abilities: As long as a tamer is near to direct it, the mechalope is an effective weapons platform, akin to a flamethrower. Like all mechanoid hybrids it produces industrial components every couple days, and chemfuel like any other boomalope.
LanguageData.GR_Mechalope.tools.0.label: head
LanguageData.GR_Mechachicken.label: mecha-chicken
LanguageData.GR_Mechachicken.description: This cybernetic organism is adept at reconnaissance and infiltration, due to its small size and speed. It is armed with a small sniper flechette gun. Like all mechanoid hybrids, it doesn't need to eat, it can't reproduce and it doesn't age. It needs to rest a bit to recharge its organic components.\n\nUseful abilities: As long as a tamer is near to direct it, the mecha-chicken can strike targets from very far away. Like all mechanoid hybrids it produces industrial components every couple days, and eggs. I'm not sure I'd eat the eggs, though.
LanguageData.GR_Mechachicken.tools.0.label: head
LanguageData.GR_Mechachicken.verbs.0.label: sniper flechette
LanguageData.GR_Mechaspider.label: mechaspider
LanguageData.GR_Mechaspider.description: This cybernetic organism has traits from both its insectoid and mechanoid origins. The mechaspider is armed with a powerful twin-coiled laser machine gun, perfect to obliterate enemies in a rain of laser fire. Like all mechanoid hybrids, it doesn't need to eat, it can't reproduce and it doesn't age. It needs to rest a bit to recharge its organic components.\n\nUseful abilities: As long as a tamer is near to direct it, the mechaspider can rain death upon enemies. Like all mechanoid hybrids it produces industrial components every couple days.
LanguageData.GR_Mechaspider.tools.0.label: head
LanguageData.GR_Mechamuffalo.label: mecha-muffalo
LanguageData.GR_Mechamuffalo.description: This hulking cybernetic organism has been reinforced with an adaptive plasteel mesh, enabling it to carry an incredible amount of stuff. The mecha-muffalo is the perfect pack animal, but it is quite useless in an offensive role. Defensively, however, it is armed with a smoke cannon that it can use to cover the battlefield in a dense cloud of dust. Like all mechanoid hybrids, it doesn't need to eat, it can't reproduce and it doesn't age. It needs to rest a bit to recharge its organic components. (due to game limitations, the Mechamuffalo consumes around 0.01 nutrition, enough to avoid messing up caravan calculations)\n\nUseful abilities: As long as a tamer is near to direct it, the mecha-muffalo can use its smoke cannon to scramble enemy sight. Like all mechanoid hybrids it produces industrial components every couple days. It also produces a weird metallic wool, and metallic tasting milk.
LanguageData.GR_Mechamuffalo.tools.0.label: head
LanguageData.GR_Mecharat.label: mecha-rat
LanguageData.GR_Mecharat.description: This tiny cybernetic organism can be mass-produced as a kind of "suicide weapon". It is very fast, and armed with a short ranged stun gun, so hordes of mecha-rats can be sent to the front lines to keep enemies stunned and in check. Like all mechanoid hybrids, it doesn't need to eat, it can't reproduce and it doesn't age. It needs to rest a bit to recharge its organic components.\n\nUseful abilities: As long as a tamer is near to direct it, mecha-rats can be sent to the enemy to stun them. Like all mechanoid hybrids it produces industrial components every couple days.
LanguageData.GR_Mecharat.tools.0.label: head
LanguageData.GR_Mechaturtle.label: mechaturtle
LanguageData.GR_Mechaturtle.description: This cybernetic beast is heavily armoured with a plasteel-encased biomechanical shell. It is armed with a poison spitting cannon. Like all mechanoid hybrids, it doesn't need to eat, it can't reproduce and it doesn't age. It needs to rest a bit to recharge its organic components.\n\nUseful abilities: As long as a tamer is near to direct it, the mechaturtle can hurl poison projectiles to the enemy. Like all mechanoid hybrids it produces industrial components every couple days. It is, of course, quite slow.
LanguageData.GR_Mechaturtle.tools.0.label: head
LanguageData.GR_Mechawolf.label: mechawolf
LanguageData.GR_Mechawolf.description: This cybernetic beast has been augmented with a powerful synthetic structure capable of generating waves of cryogenic liquid. Like all mechanoid hybrids, it doesn't need to eat, it can't reproduce and it doesn't age. It needs to rest a bit to recharge its organic components.\n\nUseful abilities: As long as a tamer is near to direct it, the mechawolf can launch cryo projectiles that freeze the ground (and enemies!) in contact. Like all mechanoid hybrids it produces industrial components every couple days.
LanguageData.GR_Mechawolf.tools.0.label: head
LanguageData.GR_Mechathrumbo.label: mechathrumbo
LanguageData.GR_Mechathrumbo.description: This hulking cybernetic behemoth is why you don't need tanks in the Rim. Its huge plasteel carapace hides a miniaturized synchrotron that constantly generates small amounts of antimatter, which is instantly used to fill a miniature antigrain warhead. Like all mechanoid hybrids, it doesn't need to eat, it can't reproduce and it doesn't age. It needs to rest a bit to recharge its organic components.\n\nUseful abilities: As long as a tamer is near to direct it, the mechathrumbo is like a mortar turret, armed with self-replenishing miniature antigrain warheads. This is SO end game... Like all mechanoid hybrids it produces industrial components every couple days.
LanguageData.GR_Mechathrumbo.tools.0.label: head
LanguageData.GR_Mechacat.label: mechacat
LanguageData.GR_Mechacat.description: The tail of this robotic creature has been crafted from an amalgamation of scyther blades and mechanite self-replicators. This allows the mechacat to use its tail as a throwable weapon, and quickly regenerate it to use it again. Like all mechanoid hybrids, it doesn't need to eat, it can't reproduce and it doesn't age. It needs to rest a bit to recharge its organic components.\n\nUseful abilities: As long as a tamer is near to direct it, the mechacat can use its tail as a dangerous throwable scythe. Like all mechanoid hybrids it produces industrial components every couple days.
LanguageData.GR_Mechacat.tools.0.label: head
LanguageData.GR_Muffalobear.label: muffalobear
LanguageData.GR_Muffalobear.description: A Muffalo / bear hybrid. The Muffalobear is a stronger variant of muffalo that doesn't produce wool. \n\nUseful abilities: Muffalobears produce a special milk, less nutritive but with a mild euphoric effect. They are pack animals that carry more weight than regular muffalos.
LanguageData.GR_Muffalobear.tools.0.label: head
LanguageData.GR_Muffalope.label: muffalope
LanguageData.GR_Muffalope.description: A Muffalo / boomalope hybrid. Because it's so cool when your caravans can EXPLODE. \n\nUseful abilities: Milk produced by these animals is not edible, but highly explosive, so it can be used to build IEDs. Can be sheared for low quality wool. Produces a decent amount of chemfuel.
LanguageData.GR_Muffalope.tools.0.label: head
LanguageData.GR_Muffalochicken.label: muffalochicken
LanguageData.GR_Muffalochicken.description: A Muffalo / chicken hybrid. A very strange bovine beast that lays eggs. \n\nUseful abilities: Produces high quality milk, wool and eggs.
LanguageData.GR_Muffalochicken.tools.0.label: head
LanguageData.GR_Muffalochicken.tools.1.label: beak
LanguageData.GR_Muffalowolf.label: muffalowolf
LanguageData.GR_Muffalowolf.description: A Muffalo / wolf hybrid. Faster than a standard muffalo, and better able to defend itself, but has lost the capacity to produce milk. \n\nUseful abilities: Quite fast pack beast.
LanguageData.GR_Muffalowolf.tools.0.label: head
LanguageData.GR_Muffalorat.label: muffalorat
LanguageData.GR_Muffalorat.description: A Muffalo / Rat hybrid. A short-lived pack beast that breeds really fast.\n\nUseful abilities: Acts as a pack beast. Produces small amounts of milk and wool at a quite fast rate. Fast breeding.
LanguageData.GR_Muffalorat.tools.0.label: head
LanguageData.GR_Muffalocat.label: muffalocat
LanguageData.GR_Muffalocat.description: A Muffalo / cat hybrid. The Muffalocat is a very intelligent muffalo hybrid that can be trained further than its brethren.\n\nUseful abilities: Muffalocats produce milk and hairball wool. They are also pack animals, though not as efficient as regular muffalos.
LanguageData.GR_Muffalocat.tools.0.label: head
LanguageData.GR_Muffalocat.tools.1.label: left hoof
LanguageData.GR_Muffalocat.tools.2.label: right hoof
LanguageData.GR_Bearodile.label: bearodile
LanguageData.GR_Bearodile.description: A reptile / bear hybrid. The reptilian genes used to generate this hybrid have given it some ancient reptilian characteristics, with an appearance similar to reptiles in the Permian Period on Earth. It has also developed a venomous bite.\n\nUseful abilities: Highly intelligent and venomous. Excellent base defender if properly trained.
LanguageData.GR_Bearodile.tools.0.label: left claw
LanguageData.GR_Bearodile.tools.1.label: right claw
LanguageData.GR_Bearodile.tools.3.label: head
LanguageData.GR_Boomsnake.label: boomsnake
LanguageData.GR_Boomsnake.description: A reptile / boomalope hybrid. The boomsnake is not a very strong or agile combatant. However, when it dies it explodes in a noxious cloud of venomous vapors, which can be strong enough to dissolve flesh.\n\nUseful abilities: Its toxic explosion can easily decimate an enemy raid if properly timed. Doesn't produce chemfuel.
LanguageData.GR_Boomsnake.tools.1.label: head
LanguageData.GR_Chickenlizard.label: chickenlizard
LanguageData.GR_Chickenlizard.description: A reptile / chicken hybrid. This reptilian chicken has a slightly venomous bite. Not very powerful, but considering how fast chickens breed, a horde of chickenlizards might be enough to overpower a much bigger creature with their venom.\n\nUseful abilities: Small, fast breeding, venomous chickens.
LanguageData.GR_Chickenlizard.tools.0.label: claws
LanguageData.GR_Chickenlizard.tools.2.label: head
LanguageData.GR_Muffalokomodo.label: muffalokomodo
LanguageData.GR_Muffalokomodo.description: A reptile / muffalo hybrid. This resilient beast can carry more weight than a regular muffalo, and has a powerful venomous bite.\n\nUseful abilities: Regularly produces enough venomous saliva to fill an ampoule with a powerful poison, which acts as a potent muscle paralysing agent.
LanguageData.GR_Spidersnake.label: spidersnake
LanguageData.GR_Spidersnake.description: A reptile / insectoid hybrid. This venomous, armoured snake, can be very dangerous in high enough numbers. Strangely, they don't seem particularly attracted to hugging any faces.\n\nUseful abilities: Regularly produces Spidersnake shed skin, which can be processed in a drug lab into small amounts of neutroamine.
LanguageData.GR_Spidersnake.tools.1.label: head
LanguageData.GR_Thrumbolizard.label: thrumbolizard
LanguageData.GR_Thrumbolizard.description: A reptile / thrumbo hybrid. A massive, crocodilian creature with incredibly powerful jaws and a rabid venom. \n\nUseful abilities: Regularly produces enough venom to fill small ampoules. Thrumbolizard poison is 100% lethal, and there is no antidote that could act fast enough.
LanguageData.GR_Thrumbolizard.tools.0.label: horn
LanguageData.GR_Thrumbolizard.tools.2.label: left foot
LanguageData.GR_Thrumbolizard.tools.3.label: right foot
LanguageData.GR_Thrumbolizard.tools.4.label: head
LanguageData.GR_Wolfsnake.label: wolfsnake
LanguageData.GR_Wolfsnake.description: A reptile / wolf hybrid. These serpentine predators are fast as lightning, and armed with a powerful, venomous bite. \n\nSpeed and poison make for a very effective base defender. Sheds wolfsnake skin from time to time.
LanguageData.GR_Wolfsnake.tools.0.label: left claw
LanguageData.GR_Wolfsnake.tools.1.label: right claw
LanguageData.GR_Wolfsnake.tools.3.label: head
LanguageData.GR_Snakecat.label: snakecat
LanguageData.GR_Snakecat.description: A reptile / cat hybrid. The snakecat is like a furry snake with tiny legs. It has a venomous bite, and can be trained much further than other reptile hybrids.\n\nUseful abilities: Like all cat hybrids, they have an improved melee dodge ability, making them perfect for the front lines, and a short nuzzle period.
LanguageData.GR_Snakecat.tools.1.label: head
LanguageData.GR_Molebear.label: molebear
LanguageData.GR_Molebear.description: A Mole / Bear hybrid. The molebear combines the resilience of a bear with the extremely low methabolic rate of a mole rat. These creatures lack pain sensitivity, so if you want to kill one, there is no "knocking it unconscious".\n\nUseful abilities: No pain sensitivity. Fast breeding.
LanguageData.GR_Molebear.tools.0.label: left claw
LanguageData.GR_Molebear.tools.1.label: right claw
LanguageData.GR_Molebear.tools.3.label: head
LanguageData.GR_Boomsquirrel.label: boomsquirrel
LanguageData.GR_Boomsquirrel.description: A Squirrel / Boomalope hybrid. This small and fast rodent has several nodules of chemical mixture in its back.\n\nUseful abilities: Explodes on death. Produces small amounts of chemfuel quite fast. Very fast breeding.
LanguageData.GR_Boomsquirrel.tools.0.label: left claw
LanguageData.GR_Boomsquirrel.tools.1.label: right claw
LanguageData.GR_Boomsquirrel.tools.3.label: head
LanguageData.GR_Rabbitchicken.label: rabbitchicken
LanguageData.GR_Rabbitchicken.description: A Rabbit / Chicken hybrid. Isn't it adorable? Awwwww... Who's the sweetest genetic abomination in all the Rim? Actually, rabbitchickens are a pest, and they tend to breed very, very fast, even faster than other rodent hybrids, and they will consume all available food unless you have a system in place to avoid it.\n\nUseful abilities: Fastest breeding of all hybrids.
LanguageData.GR_Rabbitchicken.tools.1.label: head
LanguageData.GR_Ratfallo.label: ratfallo
LanguageData.GR_Ratfallo.description: A Rat / Muffalo hybrid. This is a very large, muscular and resilient rat. It can be used as a pack animal, and also produces some milk of questionable quality.\n\nUseful abilities: Acts as a pack beast. Produces small amounts of milk and wool at a quite fast rate. Fast breeding.
LanguageData.GR_Ratfallo.tools.1.label: head
LanguageData.GR_Thrumborat.label: thrumborat
LanguageData.GR_Thrumborat.description: A Rat / Thrumbo hybrid. What could be scarier than a fast-breeding thrumbo?\n\nUseful abilities: Fast breeding and fast maturing for a creature of this size. Not very long-lived, though.
LanguageData.GR_Thrumborat.tools.0.label: horn
LanguageData.GR_Thrumborat.tools.2.label: left paw
LanguageData.GR_Thrumborat.tools.3.label: right paw
LanguageData.GR_Thrumborat.tools.4.label: head
LanguageData.GR_Beaverwolf.label: beaverwolf
LanguageData.GR_Beaverwolf.description: A Beaver / Wolf hybrid. Beaverwolves can eat either meat or trees, although they are not as voracious as the wolfbeaver hybrid. They are not as efficient in battle, but they produce castoreum, which can be used to cook.\n\nUseful abilities: Regularly produces a secretion called castoreum that can be used as a cooking ingredient. Fast breeding.
LanguageData.GR_Beaverwolf.tools.0.label: left claw
LanguageData.GR_Beaverwolf.tools.1.label: right claw
LanguageData.GR_Beaverwolf.tools.3.label: head
LanguageData.GR_Rabbitcat.label: rabbitcat
LanguageData.GR_Rabbitcat.description: A Rabbit / Cat hybrid. The rabbitcat is a very efficient predator. Equipped with excellent hearing and a keen intelligence.\n\nUseful abilities: Like all cat hybrids, they have an improved melee dodge ability, making them perfect for the front lines, and a short nuzzle period. Fast breeding. Its fangs can be used as a trophy or sold for a profit.
LanguageData.GR_Rabbitcat.tools.0.label: left claw
LanguageData.GR_Rabbitcat.tools.1.label: right claw
LanguageData.GR_Thrumbear.label: thrumbear
LanguageData.GR_Thrumbear.description: This gargantuan beast is the result of splicing bear genes in a standard thrumbo. As strong and resilient as it is easy to anger, a thrumbear attack is something to be VERY scared of.\n\nUseful abilities: Produces very high quality wool.
LanguageData.GR_Thrumbear.tools.0.label: horn
LanguageData.GR_Thrumbear.tools.2.label: left foot
LanguageData.GR_Thrumbear.tools.3.label: right foot
LanguageData.GR_Thrumbear.tools.4.label: head
LanguageData.GR_Thrumbalope.label: thrumbalope
LanguageData.GR_Thrumbalope.description: The thrumbalope is a thrumbo that has been spliced with boomalope genes. Their huge sacs of unstable chemicals explode with unbelievable force, which has caused the colonists to nickname them "nukalopes".\n\nUseful abilities: Huge, dangerous explosion on death. Produces massive amounts of chemfuel.
LanguageData.GR_Thrumbalope.tools.0.label: horn
LanguageData.GR_Thrumbalope.tools.2.label: left foot
LanguageData.GR_Thrumbalope.tools.3.label: right foot
LanguageData.GR_Thrumbalope.tools.4.label: head
LanguageData.GR_Thrumbochicken.label: thrumbochicken
LanguageData.GR_Thrumbochicken.description: The thrumbochicken is a thrumbo that has been spliced with avian genes. Although not very ravenous, these are lightning fast predators that could hunt any other creature with ease. These animals lay enormous eggs!\n\nUseful abilities: Biggest eggs of any animal.
LanguageData.GR_Thrumbochicken.tools.0.label: horn
LanguageData.GR_Thrumbochicken.tools.2.label: head
LanguageData.GR_Thrumffalo.label: thrumffalo
LanguageData.GR_Thrumffalo.description: This massive ungulate is the result of splicing a thrumbo with muffalo genes. Capable of carrying a huge amount of materials, there is no better possible pack animal in all the Rim (yet! Science never rests).\n\nUseful abilities: Produces high quality milk and wool.
LanguageData.GR_Thrumffalo.tools.0.label: horn
LanguageData.GR_Thrumffalo.tools.2.label: left foot
LanguageData.GR_Thrumffalo.tools.3.label: right foot
LanguageData.GR_Thrumffalo.tools.4.label: head
LanguageData.GR_Thrumwolf.label: thrumwolf
LanguageData.GR_Thrumwolf.description: This colossal predator is the result of splicing a thrumbo with wolf genes. Fast and really hungry, all the time. Entire ecosystems can be decimated by the insane apetite of a Thrumbowolf.\n\nUseful abilities: fast attacking predator which will tear through your enemies if properly trained. Needs a LOT of food, though.
LanguageData.GR_Thrumwolf.tools.0.label: horn
LanguageData.GR_Thrumwolf.tools.2.label: left foot
LanguageData.GR_Thrumwolf.tools.3.label: right foot
LanguageData.GR_Thrumwolf.tools.4.label: head
LanguageData.GR_Thrumbocat.label: thrumbocat
LanguageData.GR_Thrumbocat.description: A Thrumbo / Cat hybrid. The thrumbocat is a dangerous, agile predator. It can attack with its maws or its massive horn, as well as overpower its prey with a close range hairball attack.\n\nUseful abilities: Like all cat hybrids, they have an improved melee dodge ability, making them perfect for the front lines, and a short nuzzle period. Hairball attack that suffocates its prey.
LanguageData.GR_Thrumbocat.tools.0.label: horn
LanguageData.GR_Thrumbocat.tools.2.label: left foot
LanguageData.GR_Thrumbocat.tools.3.label: right foot
LanguageData.GR_Thrumbocat.tools.4.label: head
LanguageData.GR_Wolfbear.label: wolfbear
LanguageData.GR_Wolfbear.description: A Wolf / Bear hybrid. Very similar to the standard timber wolf, but with better stamina.\n\nUseful abilities: Good guard animal. Butchering gives Wolfbear paws, which can be sold.
LanguageData.GR_Wolfbear.tools.0.label: left claw
LanguageData.GR_Wolfbear.tools.1.label: right claw
LanguageData.GR_Wolfbear.tools.3.label: head
LanguageData.GR_Wolfalope.label: wolfalope
LanguageData.GR_Wolfalope.description: A Wolf / Boomalope hybrid. A very dangerous predator that tends to explode when confronted with prey too large for them. Friction between the creature's pelt and the boomalope nodules constantly creates static electricity, which is suddenly liberated when the creature dies and the nodules explode.\n\nUseful abilities: Explodes on death in a dangerous electromagnetic pulse (EMP damage). Produces average amounts of chemfuel.
LanguageData.GR_Wolfalope.tools.0.label: left claw
LanguageData.GR_Wolfalope.tools.1.label: right claw
LanguageData.GR_Wolfalope.tools.3.label: head
LanguageData.GR_Wolfchicken.label: wolfchicken
LanguageData.GR_Wolfchicken.description: A Wolf / Chicken hybrid. You know the saying: when you let the wolves guard the hen house, there's bound to be a few chicken dinners. Well, not anymore.\n\nUseful abilities: Egg layer. Regularly produces feathers that can be sold for a profit.
LanguageData.GR_Wolfchicken.tools.0.label: left claw
LanguageData.GR_Wolfchicken.tools.1.label: right claw
LanguageData.GR_Wolfchicken.tools.3.label: head
LanguageData.GR_Wolffalo.label: wolffalo
LanguageData.GR_Wolffalo.description: A Wolf / Muffalo hybrid. Not incredibly good as a pack beast, but a very fast wool producer.\n\nActs as a pack beast. Produces small amounts of milk and wool at a quite fast rate.
LanguageData.GR_Wolffalo.tools.0.label: left claw
LanguageData.GR_Wolffalo.tools.1.label: right claw
LanguageData.GR_Wolffalo.tools.2.label: head
LanguageData.GR_Wolfbeaver.label: wolfbeaver
LanguageData.GR_Wolfbeaver.description: A Wolf / Beaver hybrid. This fast breeding predator can be a drain on your tree reserves, unless you provide it with some fresh meat.\n\nUseful abilities: Fast breeding.
LanguageData.GR_Wolfbeaver.tools.0.label: left claw
LanguageData.GR_Wolfbeaver.tools.1.label: right claw
LanguageData.GR_Wolfbeaver.tools.3.label: head
LanguageData.GR_Wolfcat.label: wolfcat
LanguageData.GR_Wolfcat.description: A Wolf / Cat hybrid. This tiger-like predator is intelligent, fast and quite easy to train.\n\nUseful abilities: Like all cat hybrids, they have an improved melee dodge ability, making them perfect for the front lines, and a short nuzzle period.
LanguageData.GR_Wolfcat.tools.0.label: left claw
LanguageData.GR_Wolfcat.tools.1.label: right claw
LanguageData.GR_Wolfcat.tools.3.label: head
LanguageData.GR_MechanoidChipCell.label: mechanoid interface cell
LanguageData.GR_MechanoidChipCell.description: A mechanoid interface cell. These cells amplify the psychic abilities of mechanoid machines, allowing them to affect the minds of both people and animals.\n\nThey can be scavenged to obtain valuable mechanoid interface chips, which can then be used to interface technology with organics and to create terrifying mechanoid-organic hybrids.
